message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CY, cs.SOC, cs.CL 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as it focuses on the fragmentation of online discussion networks on Twitter. It could also belong to cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing) as it mentions the use of Twitter data to analyze political discussions. Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.CY (Computers and Society) as it discusses the impact of social media on exposure to different ideological viewpoints. It may also fit under cs.SOC (Social and Economic Networks) as it analyzes the social dynamics of online political discussions. Finally, it could be classified under cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it involves the analysis of language and communication patterns on Twitter.
